newsitem.title: UK: W.European sugar output could fall in 97/98 - Licht.
newsitem.headline: W.European sugar output could fall in 97/98 - Licht.

text.p: Sugar output in western Europe could fall by nearly 900,000 tonnes raw value in 1997/98 if more normal weather conditions return to the region and affect yields, F.O.Licht said on Thursday.

"Though the area in western Europe may be up in 1997 this need not mean that sugar output will rise as last year yields got a late boost from favourable autumn weather," Licht said in its first estimate of European beet areas.
"Based upon more normal weather this year and currently anticipated sowings, output in Western Europe might be expected to fall by nearly 900,000 tonnes."
Licht estimated the beet sowing area in western Europe to show a modest overall increase to 2.61 million tonnes from 2.57 million in 1996/97.
It noted that the reverse situation had applied to eastern Europe last season when adverse weather was reflected in sugar yields.
